  "article_text": [
    "let @xmath7 be a brownian motion on a probability space @xmath8 , where the @xmath9-field @xmath10 is generated by the brownian motion and completed by null sets .",
    "suppose @xmath11 is a square - integrable random variable with zero expectation and variance one . as a discrete counterpart of @xmath0 we consider , for every @xmath12 , a random walk approximation @xmath13 where @xmath14 is a sequence of independent random variables which have the same distribution as @xmath11 .",
    "we assume that the approximating sequence @xmath1 converges to @xmath0 pointwise in probability , i.e. @xmath15 the aim of the paper is to provide @xmath2-approximation results for some basic operators of malliavin calculus with respect to the brownian motion @xmath0 such as the chaos decomposition , the malliavin derivative , and the skorokhod integral by appropriate sequences of approximating operators based on the discrete time noise @xmath16 .",
    "it turns out that in all our approximation results , the limits do not depend on the distribution of the discrete time noise , hence our results can be regarded as some kind of invariance principle for malliavin calculus .",
    "we briefly discuss our main convergence results in a slightly informal way :    1 .",
    "_ chaos decomposition : _ the heuristic idea behind the chaos decomposition in terms of multiple wiener integrals is to project a random variable @xmath17 on products of the white noise @xmath18 .",
    "this idea can be made rigorous with respect to the discrete noise @xmath19 by considering the discrete time functions @xmath20\\ ] ] for pairwise distinct @xmath21 .",
    "our results show that , after a natural embedding as step functions into continuous time , the sequence @xmath22 converges strongly in @xmath23 to the @xmath24th chaos coefficient of @xmath5 , for every @xmath25 ( example [ example : wiener_integrals ] ) .",
    "this is a simple consequence of a general wiener chaos limit theorem ( theorem [ thm_s_transform_convergence_2 ] ) , which provides equivalent conditions for the strong @xmath26-convergence of a sequence of random variables @xmath27 ( with each @xmath6 admitting a chaos decomposition via multiple wiener integrals with respect to the discrete time noise @xmath16 ) in terms of the chaos coefficient functions . as a corollary ,",
    "this wiener chaos limit theorem lifts a classical result by @xcite on convergence in distribution of discrete multiple wiener integrals to strong @xmath26-convergence ( in our setting , i.e. when the limiting multiple wiener integral is driven by a brownian motion ) .",
    "malliavin derivative : _ with our weak moment assumptions on the discrete time noise , we can not define a discrete malliavin derivative in terms of a polynomial chaos as in the survey paper by @xcite and the references therein .",
    "instead we introduce the discretized malliavin derivative at time @xmath28 with respect to the noise @xmath16 by @xmath29,\\ ] ] which is the gradient of the best approximation in @xmath26 of @xmath5 as a linear function in @xmath30 with @xmath31-measurable coefficients .",
    "theorem [ thm_malliavin_derivative_convergence_1 ] below implies that , if @xmath3 converges weakly in @xmath26 to @xmath5 and the sequence of discretized malliavin derivatives @xmath32 converges weakly in @xmath33 , then @xmath5 belongs to the domain of the continuous malliavin derivative and the continuous malliavin derivative appears as the weak @xmath33-limit . as the malliavin derivative is a closed , but discontinuous operator , this is the best type of approximation result which can be expected when discretizing the malliavin derivative .",
    "sufficient conditions for the strong convergence of a sequence of discretized malliavin derivatives , which can be checked in terms of the discrete - time approximations , are presented in theorems [ thm : d22 ] and [ thm_malliavin_derivative_convergence ] .",
    "3 .   _ skorokhod integral : _ defining the discrete skorokhod integral as the adjoint operator to the discretized malliavin derivative leads to @xmath34 \\frac{\\xi^n_i}{\\sqrt{n}},\\ ] ] for a suitable class of discrete time processes @xmath35 , which is in line with the riemann - sum approximation for skorokhod integrals in terms of the driving brownian motion in @xcite .",
    "analogous results for the ` closedness across the discretization levels ' as in the case of the discretized malliavin derivative and sufficient conditions for strong @xmath26-convergence of a sequence of discrete skorokhod integrals are provided in theorems [ thm : skorokhod_convergence_1 ] , [ thm : l22 ] and [ thm : skorokhod_convergence_2 ] .",
    "when restricted to predictable integrands , the convergence results for the skorokhod integral give rise to necessary and sufficient conditions for strong and weak @xmath26-convergence of a sequence of discrete it integrals ( theorem [ thm : ito_integral ] ) .",
    "this result can be applied to study different discretization schemes for the generalized clark - ocone derivative ( which provides the integrand in the predictable representation of a square - integrable random variable as it integral with respect to the brownian motion @xmath0 ) . in this respect ,",
    "theorems [ thm : clark - ocone_1 ] and [ thm : clark - ocone_2 ] below complement related results in the literature such as @xcite and the references therein .",
    "we note that related classical semimartingale limit theorems for stochastic integrals ( with adapted integrands ) @xcite and for multiple wiener integrals @xcite , or robustness results for martingale representations @xcite are usually obtained in the framework of ( or using techniques of ) convergence in distribution ( on the skorokhod space ) .",
    "in contrast , we exploit that strong and weak convergence in @xmath26 can be characterized in terms of the @xmath36-transform , which is an important tool in white noise analysis , see e.g. @xcite , and corresponds to taking expectation under suitable changes of measure .",
    "we introduce a discrete version of the @xmath36-transform in terms of the noise @xmath16 and show that strong and weak @xmath26-convergence can be equivalently expressed via convergence of the discrete @xmath36-transform to the continuous @xmath36-transform ( theorem [ thm_s_transform_convergence_1 ] ) . with this observation at hand ,",
    "all our convergence results can be obtained in a surprisingly simple way by computing suitable @xmath37-inner products and their limits as @xmath38 tends to infinity .",
    "however , all these results can be seen as strong and weak invariance principles for malliavin calculus .",
    "the paper is organized as follows : in section [ section_s_transform ] , we introduce the discrete @xmath36-transform and discuss the connections between weak ( and strong ) @xmath26-convergence and the convergence of the discrete @xmath36-transform to the continuous one .",
    "equivalent conditions for the weak @xmath2-convergence of sequences of discretized malliavin derivatives and discrete skorokhod integrals to their continuous counterparts are derived in section [ section_malliavin_weak ] . combining these weak @xmath2-convergence results with the duality between discrete skorokhod integral and discretized malliavin derivative",
    ", we also identify sufficient conditions for the strong @xmath2-convergence which can be checked solely in terms of the discrete time approximations .",
    "we are not aware of any such convergence results for general discrete time noise distributions in the literature . in section",
    "[ section : ito ] , we specialize to the nonanticipating case and prove limit theorems for discrete it integrals and discretized clark - ocone derivatives .",
    "the strong @xmath2-wiener chaos limit theorem is presented in section [ section_chaos_decomposition ] , and is applied in order to provide equivalent conditions for the strong @xmath2-convergence of sequences of discretized malliavin derivatives and discrete skorokhod integrals in terms of tail conditions of the discrete chaos coefficients in section [ sec : malliavin2 ] .",
    "finally , in section [ section_binary ] , we consider the special case of binary noise , in which discrete malliavin calculus is very well studied , see e.g. the monograph by @xcite .",
    "we explain that the statement of our convergence results can be simplified in this case and demonstrate by a toy example how to apply the results numerically in a monte carlo framework .",
    "in this section , we study strong and weak @xmath26-convergence of a sequence @xmath3 of random variables , where @xmath6 is @xmath39-measurable , to an @xmath40-measurable @xmath5 . as a main result of this section ( theorem [ thm_s_transform_convergence_1 ] ) , we provide an equivalent criterion for this convergence , which only requires to compute a family of @xmath41-inner products ( hence , expectations which involve functionals of the discrete time noise @xmath16 only ) and their limits as @xmath38 tends to infinity .    before doing so ,",
    "let us recall that @xmath1 can be constructed via a skorokhod embedding of the random walk @xmath42 into the rescaled brownian motion @xmath43 .",
    "in this way , one obtains , for every @xmath44 , a sequence of stopping times @xmath45 with respect to the augmentation of the filtration generated by @xmath0 such that @xmath46 has the same distribution as @xmath47 and converges to @xmath0 uniformly on compacts in probability ( see e.g. ( * ? ? ?",
    "* lemma 5.24 ( b ) ) ) .",
    "we now introduce the @xmath36-transform simultaneously in the continuous time setting and the discrete time setting , which turns ou to be the key tool for the proofs of our limit theorems .",
    "recall , that the mapping @xmath48}\\mapsto b_t$ ] can be extended to a continuous linear mapping from @xmath49 to @xmath50 , which is known as the _ wiener integral_. we denote the wiener integral of a function @xmath51 by @xmath52 .",
    "the _ discrete wiener integral _ is given by @xmath53 here , the discrete time function @xmath54 is a member of @xmath55 which obviously ensures that the series @xmath56 converges ( strongly ) in @xmath41 .",
    "the _ wick exponential _ is , by definition , the stochastic exponential of a wiener integral @xmath52 , i.e. , @xmath57 hence , its discrete counterpart , the _ discrete wick exponential _ , is given by @xmath58 in particular , by fatou s lemma and the estimate @xmath59 , @xmath60\\leq    \\exp(\\|f^n\\|_{l^2_n(\\n)}^2)<\\infty.\\ ] ] notice also that @xmath61 } ) ) - \\exp^{\\diamond_n}(i^n(f^n\\eins_{[1,i-1 ] } ) ) \\right )    \\\\ & = & 1+\\sum_{i=1}^\\infty f^n(i ) \\exp^{\\diamond_n}(i^n(f^n\\eins_{[1,i-1 ] } ) ) \\frac{\\xi^n_i}{\\sqrt{n } } ,   \\end{aligned}\\ ] ] which is the discrete counterpart of the dolans - dade equation .",

    "discrete s - transform _ as @xmath67.\\ ] ] we emphasize that the @xmath36-transform is a powerful tool in the white noise analysis , see , e.g. , @xcite , and has been succesfully applied in the theory of stochastic partial differential equations , see @xcite .",
    "to the best of our knowledge the discrete @xmath36-transform has , however , not been studied in the literature .",
    "let us next denote by @xmath68 the set of step functions on left half - open intervals , i.e. , functions of the form @xmath69}(x),\\quad m\\in \\n , a_j , b_j , c_j\\in \\r.\\ ] ] as the set of wick exponentials of step functions",

    "in this section , we first discuss weak @xmath2-approximations of the skorokhod integral and the malliavin derivative via appropriate discrete - time counterparts .",
    "we then show how to lift these results from weak convergence to strong convergence via duality under appropriate conditions which can be formulated in terms of the discrete - time approximations .",
    "while most presentations of malliavin calculus first introduce the malliavin derivative and then define the skorokhod integral as adjoint operator of the malliavin derivative , we shall here employ the following equivalent characterization of the skorokhod integral in terms of the @xmath36-transform , cp .",
    "* theorem 16.46 , theorem 16.50 ) .",
    "[ def : skorokhod ] @xmath174 is said to belong to the domain @xmath175 of the skorokhod integral , if there is an @xmath176 such that for every @xmath73 @xmath177 in this case , @xmath5 is uniquely determined and @xmath178 is called the _",
    "skorokhod integral of @xmath179_.    for the discrete - time approximation we first introduce the space @xmath180<\\infty\\right\\}.\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] moreover , we recall the definitions @xmath181 and introduce the shorthand notations @xmath182    we say , @xmath183 belongs to the domain @xmath184 of the discrete skorokhod integral , if @xmath185 \\frac{\\xi^n_i}{\\sqrt{n}}.\\ ] ] exists strongly in @xmath26 .",
    "if this is the case , @xmath186 is called the _ discrete skorokhod integral _ of @xmath35 .",
    "we note that , by the independence of @xmath187 $ ] and @xmath124 , each summand on the right - hand side of ( [ eq : discrete_skorokhod ] ) is indeed a member of @xmath26 .",
    "moreover , the martingale convergence theorem implies that , for every @xmath183 and @xmath188 , @xmath189 } \\in d(\\delta^{n})$ ] and @xmath190})=\\sum_{i=1}^n \\ex[z^n_i|\\f^n_{-i } ] \\frac{\\xi^n_i}{\\sqrt{n}}.\\ ] ] hence , the discrete skorokhod integral is densely defined from @xmath191 to @xmath26 .",
    "we will show in proposition [ prop : duality_discrete ] below that it is a closed operator .",
    "this definition of the discrete skorokhod integral closely resembles the following riemann - sum approximation of the skorokhod integral by @xcite , who show that under appropriate conditions on @xmath179 , @xmath192})=\\lim_{n\\rightarrow \\infty } \\sum_{i=0}^{n-1 } \\ex\\left[\\left.n\\int_{i / n}^{(i+1)/n } z_s ds \\right|(b_s , b_1-b_{r})_{0\\leq s\\leq i / n\\leq ( i+1)/n\\leq r\\leq 1 } \\right ] \\left(b_{(i+1)/n}-b_{i / n}\\right)\\ ] ] strongly in @xmath26 .    as a first main result of this section we are going to show the following weak approximation theorem for skorokhod integrals .",

    "we are now ready to give the proof of theorem [ thm : skorokhod_convergence_1 ] .",
    "as the implication ` @xmath219 ' is trivial , we only have to show the converse implication . to this end , note",
    "first that , by proposition [ prop : skorokhod_stransform_discrete ] and theorem [ thm_s_transform_process_convergence_discrete ] , for every @xmath73 , @xmath220 as the sequence @xmath221 is norm bounded by ( i ) , it has a weakly convergent subsequence ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem v.2.1 ) .",

    "we now turn to the weak approximation of the malliavin derivative .",
    "again , we apply a definition in terms of the @xmath36-transform , which we show to be equivalent to the more classical one in terms of the chaos decomposition in the appendix .",
    "[ prop : malliavin_domain ] a random variable @xmath176 is said to belong to the domain @xmath224 of the malliavin derivative , if there is a stochastic process @xmath225 such that for every @xmath226 , @xmath227.\\ ] ] in this case , @xmath179 is unique and @xmath228 is called the _ malliavin derivative _ @xmath5 .",
    "for every @xmath176 we define the discretized malliavin derivative of @xmath5 at @xmath28 with respect to @xmath16 by @xmath229.\\ ] ] we observe that , for fixed @xmath230 , @xmath231 is a continuous linear operator from @xmath26 to @xmath26 , because by hlder s inequality for conditional expectations and the independence of the family @xmath16 , @xmath232\\,\\ex[(\\xi^n_j)^2| \\f^n_{-j}]= n   \\ex[x^2|\\f^n_{-j}].\\ ] ]    we say that @xmath5 belongs to the domain @xmath233 of the discretized malliavin derivative , if the process @xmath234 is a member of @xmath191 . in this case",
    "@xmath235 is called the _",
    "discretized malliavin derivative _ of @xmath5 with respect to @xmath16 . as @xmath231 is continuous for fixed @xmath230 , it is easy to check that the discretized malliavin derivative is a densely defined closed operator from @xmath26 to @xmath191 .    in the following theorem and in the remainder of the paper",
    "we use the convention @xmath236 for @xmath237 .",
    "[ thm_malliavin_derivative_convergence_1 ] suppose @xmath27 converges to @xmath5 weakly in @xmath26 and @xmath238 for every @xmath44 .",
    "then , the following are equivalent :    1 .",

    "2 .   @xmath240 and @xmath32 converges to @xmath241 weakly in @xmath33 .",
    "the proof is prepared by two propositions .",
    "the first one contains the duality relation between the discrete skorokhod integral and discretized malliavin derivative .",
    "[ prop : duality_discrete ] for every @xmath44 , the discrete skorokhod integral is the adjoint operator of the discretized malliavin derivative . in particular , @xmath242 is closed and , for every @xmath243 and @xmath193 , @xmath244=\\ex[\\delta^n(z^n ) x].\\ ] ]    we emphasize that , choosing @xmath245 , @xmath73 , in proposition [ prop : duality_discrete ] , we obtain the assertion of proposition [ prop : skorokhod_stransform_discrete ] .",
    "indeed , we only have to note that , for every @xmath246 , @xmath247    suppose first , that @xmath193 and @xmath243 . then , for every @xmath248 , and @xmath249 , @xmath250\\right|^2\\right]\\leq \\ex\\left[\\left|d^n_ix\\right|^2\\right].\\ ] ] hence , by the martingale convergence theorem and dominated convergence , @xmath251- d^n_ix\\right|^2 \\right ] = 0.\\ ] ] consequently , @xmath252   & = & \\lim_{m\\rightarrow \\infty } \\frac{1}{n } \\sum_{i=1}^m   \\ex\\left[z^n_i   \\sqrt{n } \\ex[\\xi^n_i x|\\f^n_{m ,- i } ] \\right ]   \\\\ & = &    \\lim_{m\\rightarrow \\infty}\\frac{1}{\\sqrt n } \\sum_{i=1}^m   \\ex\\left [ x \\xi^n_i    \\ex[z^n_i|\\f^n_{m ,- i } ] \\right ]   \\\\ & = & \\lim_{m\\rightarrow \\infty } \\ex\\left[x \\sum_{i=1}^m   \\ex[z^n_i|\\f^n_{m ,- i } ] \\frac{\\xi^n_i}{\\sqrt n } \\right ]    =    \\ex [ x\\delta^n(z^n ) ] .    \\end{aligned}\\ ] ] conversely , suppose that @xmath35 is in the domain of the adjoint operator of the discretized malliavin derivative , i.e. , there is an @xmath253 such that for every @xmath243 , @xmath254=\\ex[y^n x].\\ ] ] we first note that , by construction , @xmath243 if and only @xmath255 \\in \\d^{1,2}_n$ ] , and , if this is the case , both random variables have the same discretized malliavin derivative . hence , applying the duality relation ( [ eq : hilf_duality ] ) , with @xmath5 and @xmath255 $ ] , we observe that , @xmath256 $ ] .",

    "in this section , we first specialize the approximation result for the skorokhod integral to predictable integrands . in this way",
    ", we obtain necessary and sufficient conditions for strong and weak @xmath2-convergence of discrete it integrals with respect to the noise @xmath19 to it integrals with respect to the brownian motion @xmath0 .",
    "then , we discuss strong and weak @xmath2-approximations to the clark - ocone derivative , which provides the predictable integral representation of a random variable in @xmath26 with respect to the brownian motion @xmath0 .",
    "suppose @xmath183 is predictable with respect to @xmath353 , i.e. , for every @xmath249 , @xmath354 is measurable with respect to @xmath355 .",
    "then , @xmath356 which means that the discrete skorokhod integral reduces to the discrete it integral .",
    "analogously , the skorokhod integral @xmath198 is well - known to coincide with the it integral @xmath357 , when @xmath358 is predictable with respect to the augmented brownian filtration @xmath359 , see , e.g. ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 7.41 ) .    in this case of predictable integrands , the approximation theorem for skorokhod integrals ( theorem [ thm : skorokhod_convergence_1 ] ) can be improved as follows .",
    "[ thm : ito_integral ] suppose @xmath225 is predictable with respect to the augmented brownian filtration @xmath359 , and , for every @xmath360 , @xmath361 is predictable with respect to @xmath353",
    ". then , the following are equivalent :    1 .",
    "@xmath194 converges to @xmath179 strongly ( resp .",
    "weakly ) in @xmath33 .",
    "the sequence of discrete it integrals @xmath362 converges strongly ( resp . weakly ) in @xmath26 to @xmath357 .",
    "we note that , in order to study convergence of it integrals ( with respect to different filtrations ) , techniques of convergence in distribution on the skorokhod space of right - continuous functions with left limits are classically applied .",
    "e.g. , the results by @xcite immediately imply the following result in our setting : suppose that @xmath179 is predictable with respect to the brownian filtration and its paths are right - continuous with left limits .",
    "moreover , assume that @xmath35 is predictable with respect to @xmath353 and @xmath363 converges to @xmath179 uniformly on compacts in probability .",
    "then , @xmath364 uniformly on compacts in probability .",
    "in contrast , our theorem [ thm : ito_integral ] provides an @xmath2-theory and , in particular , includes the converse implication , namely that convergence of the discrete it integrals implies convergence of the integrands .",
    "the proof of theorem [ thm : ito_integral ] will make use of the following proposition .",
    "[ prop : ito ] suppose @xmath226 .",
    "then , strongly in @xmath33 , @xmath365 } ) ) \\check h^n(\\lceil n \\cdot\\rceil)=\\exp^{\\diamond}(i ( g \\eins_{(0,\\cdot ] } ) ) h(\\cdot).\\ ] ]    recall that the support of @xmath277 is contained in @xmath366 $ ] for some @xmath248 .",
    "hence , we can decompose , @xmath367 } ) ) { \\check h^n}(\\lceil nt \\rceil )    -\\exp^{\\diamond}(i(g \\eins_{(0,t ] } ) ) h(t ) \\right)^2 \\right]dt    \\\\ & \\leq &     2 \\int_0^m \\ex\\left[\\left(\\exp^{\\diamond_n}(i^n(\\check g^n \\eins_{[1,\\lfloor n t\\rfloor ] } ) )     -\\exp^{\\diamond}(i ( g \\eins_{(0,t ] } ) )   \\right)^2 \\right]h(t)^2   dt \\\\    \\\\ & & + 2 \\int_0^\\infty \\ex\\left[\\left(\\exp^{\\diamond_n}(i^n(\\check g^n \\eins_{[1,\\lceil n t\\rceil-1 ] } ) )      \\right)^2 \\right ] |{\\check h^n}(\\lceil nt \\rceil)-h(t)|^2 dt ,   \\end{aligned}\\ ] ] since @xmath368 for lebesgue almost every @xmath128 .",
    "as , by ( [ eq : exponential_l2 ] ) @xmath369 } ) ) \\right)^2 \\right ]   \\leq   \\sup_{n\\in \\n } \\exp ( \\| { \\check g^n}(\\lceil n\\cdot \\rceil)\\|^2_{l^2([0,\\infty ) ) }       ) < \\infty,\\ ] ] the second term goes to zero by ( [ eq : hilf0001 ] ) .",
    "moreover , by the boundedness of @xmath277 , the first one tends to zero by the dominated convergence theorem , since , for every @xmath370 , by proposition [ proposition_wiener_and_wick_exp ] , @xmath371 } ) ) )     -\\exp^{\\diamond}(i ( g \\eins_{(0,t ] } ) ) \\right)^2 \\right ] = 0.\\ ] ]    ` @xmath372 ' : by the isometry for discrete it integrals , we have @xmath373= \\ex\\left [ \\left|\\sum_{i=1}^\\infty   z^n_i \\frac{1}{\\sqrt{n}}\\xi_i^n\\right|^2 \\right]= \\int_0^\\infty \\ex\\left [ |z^n_{\\lceil ns\\rceil}|^2 \\right ] ds.\\ ] ] hence , if @xmath374 converges to @xmath179 weakly in @xmath26 , then the left - hand side in ( [ eq : hilf0019 ] ) is bounded in @xmath44 , and so theorem [ thm : skorokhod_convergence_1 ] implies the asserted weak @xmath26 convergence of the sequence of discrete it integrals to @xmath357 . if @xmath374 converges to @xmath179 strongly in @xmath26 , then , by ( [ eq : hilf0019 ] ) and the continuous time it isometry , @xmath375=\\int_0^\\infty \\ex\\left [ |z_s|^2 \\right]ds   = \\ex\\left[\\left(\\int_0^\\infty z_s db_s\\right)^2 \\right],\\ ] ] which turns the weak @xmath26-convergence of the sequence of discrete it integrals into strong @xmath26-convergence .",
    "+ ` @xmath376 ' : we first assume that the sequence of discrete it integrals converges weakly in @xmath26 to the continuous time it integral . by the implication",
    "` @xmath372 ' ( which we have already proved ) and proposition [ prop : ito ] , we obtain , for every @xmath226 , @xmath377 } ) ) \\check{h}^n(i)\\frac{1}{\\sqrt{n}}\\xi_i^n=\\int_0^\\infty   \\exp^\\diamond(i(g \\eins_{(0,s]}))\\,h(s)\\,db_s\\ ] ] strongly in @xmath26 .",

    "if we instead assume strong @xmath26-convergence of the sequence of the discrete it integrals , a straightforward application of the isometries for discrete and continuous - time it integrals turns the weak @xmath33-convergence again into strong convergence .",

    "given a general element @xmath499 we define its embedding into simple continuous time functions in @xmath24 variables as @xmath500 \\times \\cdots \\times ( \\frac{i_k-1}{n } , \\frac{i_k}{n}]}(u_1 , \\ldots , u_k),\\label{eq_embedding_of_discrete_function }   \\end{aligned}\\ ] ] which is consistent with the notation already applied in ( [ eq_thm_s_transform_convergence_2_integrand ] ) and ( [ eq_discrete_chaos_integrand ] ) . here and in what follows , we apply the convention that @xmath501 vanishes when one of its arguments is set to zero .",
    "we can now rephrase theorem [ thm_s_transform_convergence_2 ] in the following way : + _ the sequence @xmath3 , with @xmath437 , converges to @xmath5 strongly in @xmath26 , if and only if , for all orders @xmath502 , the sequence of coefficient functions of the discrete chaos decomposition of @xmath6 converge ( after the natural embedding into continuous time ) to the coefficient functions of the wiener chaos of @xmath5 strongly in @xmath23 and the tail condition ( [ eq : limlimsup ] ) is satisfied . _",
    "+    [ rem_main_theorem ] convergence of discrete multiple wiener integrals to continuous multiple wiener integrals was studied in @xcite as a main tool for proving noncentral limit theorems .",
    "the results in section 4 of the latter reference imply that , for every @xmath502 , the sequence of discrete multiple wiener integrals @xmath503 converges in distribution to the multiple wiener integral @xmath504 , if @xmath505 converges to @xmath506 strongly in @xmath23 .",
    "our result lifts this convergence in distribution to strong @xmath26-convergence and adds the converse : @xmath507 we note that the @xmath26-convergence of the sequence @xmath508 even implies convergence in @xmath509 for @xmath510 , if @xmath511<\\infty$ ] for some @xmath512 . indeed , in this case",

    "\\(i ) we decompose , @xmath531 the second term goes to zero by assumption .",
    "the first one equals @xmath532 the sequence of integrands tends to 0 almost everywhere , because @xmath533 moreover , the sequence of integrands inherits uniform integrability from the @xmath23-convergent series @xmath522 .",
    "therefore , the first term goes to zero by interchanging limit and integration .",

    "dx_k \\right|\\\\   \\displaybreak[0 ] & \\leq \\left(\\sup_{m \\in \\n}\\|f^{m , k}\\|_{l^2_n(\\n)}\\right)^{1/2}\\|g^{{\\otimes } k}- \\widehat{(\\check{g}^n)^{{\\otimes } k}}\\|_{l^2([0,\\infty)^k)},\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] which tends to zero for @xmath544 by lemma [ lem : diagonal ] .     "since the set @xmath567 is total in @xmath568 , we may conclude that @xmath569 converges weakly in @xmath568 to @xmath506 by ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem v.1.3 ) . finally , turns this weak convergence into strong @xmath570-convergence .",
    "in particular , the @xmath24th coefficient in the chaos decomposition of the limiting random variable @xmath5 is the strong @xmath570-limit of @xmath569 , as asserted .",
    "it remains to show ( [ eq : limlimsup ] ) .",

    "we close this section with an example .",

    "these two approximation formulas for the chaos coefficients of @xmath5 are one way to give a rigorous meaning of the heuristic formula @xmath591,\\ ] ] where @xmath592 is white noise , which is called wiener s intuitive recipe in @xcite .",
    "the latter paper provides another rigorous meaning to wiener s recipe via nonstandard analysis , which is closely related to our approximation formulas in the special case of symmetric bernoulli noise .",
    "the authors show that @xmath593,\\quad t_l\\in t=\\{j",
    "\\delta t,\\;0\\leq j < n^2\\},\\ ] ] where @xmath594 is infinite , @xmath595 , @xmath596 , @xmath597 , @xmath598 , which is equipped with the internal counting measure , @xmath599 is a lifting of @xmath5 , @xmath600 is the expectation operator with respect to the internal counting measure , and the circle denotes the standard part .",
    "in this section , we apply the wiener chaos limit theorem ( theorem [ thm_s_transform_convergence_2 ] ) in order to prove strong @xmath2-approximation results for the skorokhod integral and the malliavin derivative . for the construction of the approximating sequences we compose the discrete skorokhod integral and the discretized malliavin derivative with the orthogonal projection on @xmath416 , i.e. on the subspace of random variables which admit a discrete chaos decomposition in terms of multiple integrals with respect to the discrete time noise @xmath16 .",
    "we first treat the malliavin derivative and aim at proving the following result .",
    "[ thm_malliavin_derivative_convergence ] suppose @xmath27 converges strongly in @xmath26 to @xmath5 and , for every @xmath44 , @xmath601 .",

    "thus , due to theorem [ thm_s_transform_convergence_2 ] and ( [ eq : skorokhod_discrete_chaos ] ) , @xmath649 now , the implication ` @xmath376 ' is obvious , while the converse implication is a consequence of theorem [ thm : skorokhod_convergence_1 ] .    as a by - product of the proof of theorem [ thm : skorokhod_convergence_2 ] , we recover , thanks to theorem [ thm_s_transform_convergence_2 ] , the well - known chaos decomposition of the skorokhod integral as @xmath650",
    "in this section , we specialize to the case of binary noise , i.e. , we suppose that , for some constant @xmath651 , @xmath652 we illustrate , that in this binary case , our approximation formulas for the malliavin derivative and the skorokhod integral give rise to a straightforward numerical implementation .",
    "we recall first that malliavin calculus on the bernoulli space is well - studied , see , e.g. @xcite , @xcite , @xcite , and the references therein , usually with the aim to explain the main ideas of malliavin calculus by discussing the analogous operators in the simple toy setting .",
    "note first that @xmath653 equals @xmath453 in the binary case ( and in this case only ) by observing that both spaces have dimension @xmath654 in this case .",
    "hence , @xmath655 coincides with @xmath416 for binary noise , and we can drop the orthogonal projections @xmath656 on @xmath416 in the statement of all previous results . in particular , every random variable @xmath657 then admits a chaos decomposition in terms of discrete multiple wiener integrals , and the representations of the discretized malliavin derivative and the discrete skorokhod integral in terms of the discrete chaos in section [ sec : malliavin2 ] show that these operators coincide with the malliavin derivative and the skorokhod integral on the bernoulli space , see @xcite .    in the binary case ,",
    "the representations for the discrete mallivain derivative and the discrete skorokhod integral can be simplified considerably .",
    "suppose @xmath657 .",
    "then , there is a measurable map @xmath658 such that @xmath659 .",
    "a direct computation shows that , for every @xmath249 , @xmath660 \\\\ &",
    "= & \\frac{\\sqrt{n } b}{b^2 + 1 } \\left ( f_{x^n}(\\xi^n_1,\\ldots,\\xi^n_{i-1},b,\\xi^n_{i+1},\\ldots)-   f_{x^n}(\\xi^n_1,\\ldots,\\xi^n_{i-1},-1/b,\\xi^n_{i+1},\\ldots ) \\right),\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] hence , the malliavin derivative becomes a difference operator .",
    "moreover , for @xmath237 and @xmath661 , the discrete skorokhod integral can be rewritten as @xmath662 } ) = \\sum_{i=1}^n z^n_i \\frac{\\xi^n_i}{\\sqrt n } -\\frac{1}{n}\\sum_{i=1}^n ( \\xi^n_i)^2 d^n_i z^n_i,\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] which can either be derived from ( * ? ? ?",
    "* proposition 1.8.3 ) or by expanding @xmath354 in its walsh decomposition and noting that , for every finite subset @xmath663 , @xmath664\\right)\\sqrt{n } \\xi^n_i =   \\left\\{\\begin{array}{cl } \\sqrt{n } \\xi^n_{a\\setminus\\{i\\ } } ( \\xi^n_i)^2 , & i\\in a \\\\   0 , & i \\notin a \\end{array } \\right\\ } = ( \\xi^n_i)^2 d^n_i \\xi^n_a.\\ ] ] hence , for @xmath237 and @xmath661 , @xmath665 } ) & =   \\sum_{i=1}^n f_{z^n_i}(\\xi^n_1,\\xi^n_2,\\ldots ) \\frac{\\xi^n_i}{\\sqrt n }    \\nonumber\\\\    & -\\frac { ( \\xi^n_i)^2 b}{\\sqrt{n}(b^2 + 1 ) } \\left ( f_{z^n_i}(\\xi^n_1,\\ldots,\\xi^n_{i-1},b,\\xi^n_{i+1},\\ldots)-   f_{z^n_i}(\\xi^n_1,\\ldots,\\xi^n_{i-1},-1/b,\\xi^n_{i+1},\\ldots ) \\right ) .",
    "\\end{aligned}\\ ] ]    recall that the discrete noise @xmath16 , can be constructed from the underlying brownian motion @xmath666 via a skorokhod embedding as @xmath667 where , in the binary case , @xmath668 and the brownian motion at the first - passage times @xmath669 can be simulated by the acceptance - rejection algorithm of @xcite .",
    "we close this paper by a toy example which illustrates how to numerically compute skorokhod integrals by our approximation results .    in this example",
    ", we approximate the skorokhod integral @xmath198 for the process @xmath670}(t ) , \\quad t\\geq 0,\\ ] ] where we choose the sign - function to be rightcontinuous at 0 .",
    "for the discrete time approximation we consider @xmath671}(i),\\quad i\\in \\n,\\ ] ] and note that @xmath672 converges to @xmath673 for almost every @xmath128 in probability by ( [ eq_donsker_embedding ] ) .",
    "hence , by uniform integrability and dominated convergence , it is easy to check that @xmath345 converges to @xmath179 strongly in @xmath33 .",
    "-approximation as the number of time steps increases . ]",
    "we next observe that in the discrete chaos decomposition of @xmath186 , all the coefficient functions @xmath674 for @xmath675 vanish , because @xmath354 is a polynomial of degree 2 in @xmath1 .",
    "hence , the tail condition in theorem [ thm : skorokhod_convergence_2 ] is trivially satisfied and , consequently , @xmath221 converges to @xmath198 strongly in @xmath26 .",
    "we now suppose that @xmath1 is constructed via the skorokhod embedding ( [ eq : embedding_binary ] ) and simulate , for @xmath676 , 10000 independent copies @xmath677 of @xmath1 by the burq&jones algorithm .",

    "in this appendix , we prove the equivalence between the definition of the malliavin derivative in terms of the @xmath36-transform ( definition [ prop : malliavin_domain ] ) and the more classical characterization in terms of the chaos decomposition , see ( [ eq : malliavin_domain])([eq : malliavin_chaos ] ) .",

    "holden , h. and lindstrm , t. and ksendal , b. and ube , j. discrete wick products .",
    "stochastic analysis and related topics ( oslo , 1992 ) , stochastics monogr . ,",
    "* 8 * , gordon and breach , montreux , 123148 , ( 1993 ) ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> suppose @xmath0 is a brownian motion and @xmath1 is an approximating sequence of rescaled random walks on the same probability space converging to @xmath0 pointwise in probability . </S>",
    "<S> we provide necessary and sufficient conditions for weak and strong @xmath2-convergence of a discretized malliavin derivative , a discrete skorokhod integral , and discrete analogues of the clark - ocone derivative to their continuous counterparts . </S>",
    "<S> moreover , given a sequence @xmath3 of random variables which admit a chaos decomposition in terms of discrete multiple wiener integrals with respect to @xmath1 , we derive necessary and sufficient conditions for strong @xmath2-convergence to a @xmath4-measurable random variable @xmath5 via convergence of the discrete chaos coefficients of @xmath6 to the continuous chaos coefficients of @xmath5 . in the special case of binary noise , </S>",
    "<S> our results support the known formal analogies between malliavin calculus on the wiener space and malliavin calculus on the bernoulli space by rigorous @xmath2-convergence results . </S>"
  ]
}
